RingNumber.name: Ring Number
RingNumber.description: For modbus master port,Two ports with the same ring number compose a ring (0:not in a ring;other:port in a ring)

ResponseDelay.name: Response Delay
ResponseDelay.description: When port configured as slave,this parameter specifies the number of milliseconds to delay before response

ResponseTimeout.name: Response Timeout
ResponseTimeout.description: When port configured as master,this parameter specifies the command response timeout period,in unit of milliseconds

RetryCount.name: Retry Count
RetryCount.description: When port configured as master,this parameter specifies the retry count for failed command

ErrorDelayCounter.name: Error Delay Counter
ErrorDelayCounter.description: When port configured as master,this parameter specifies the poll attempts to be skipped before trying to reestablish communications with a slave that has failed to respond to a command

BitInputOffset.name: Bit Input Offset
BitInputOffset.description: When port configured as slave,this parameter specifies the internal database offset for binary input status data,MB function code:2,in unit of WORD

BitOutputOffset.name: Bit Output Offset
BitOutputOffset.description: When port configured as slave,this parameter specifies the internal database offset for binary output coil data,MB function code:1,5,15,int unit of WORD

WordInputOffset.name: Word Input Offset
WordInputOffset.description: When port configured as slave,this parameter specifies the internal database offset for input register data,MB function code:4,int unit of WORD

HoldingRegisterOffset.name: Holding Register Offset
HoldingRegisterOffset.description: When port configured as slave,this parameter specifies the internal database offset for holding register data,MB function code:3,6,16,23,int unit of WORD

Enable.name: Enable
Enable.description: This field defines whether or not the command is to be executed. 0:Disable. 1:The command executes only if the internal data associated with the command changes. 2: The command is executed each scan of the command list.

DBOffset.name: DB Offset
DBOffset.description: This field specifies the database address in the module's internal database to be associated with the command.

Interval.name: Interval
Interval.description: This parameter specifies the minimum interval to execute continuous commands

RegCount.name: Reg Count
RegCount.description: This parameter specifies the number of registers or digital points to be associated with the command.

Swap.name: Swap
Swap.description: This parameter defines if the data received from the Server is to be ordered differently than that received from the Server device. 0:no swap. 1:bytes swap.

SlaveId.name: Slave ID
SlaveId.description: This parameter specifies the Modbus slave node address on the network to be considered. 1~255 is valid.

FuncCode.name: Func Code
FuncCode.description: 1,2,3,4,5,6,15,16. This parameter specifies the Modbus function to be executed by the command. 1 = Read Coil (0X) 2 = Read Input (1x) 3 = Read Holding Registers(4X) 4 = Read Input Registers(3X) 5 = Force (Write) Single Coil (0X) 6 = Preset (Write) Single Register(4X) 15 = Force (Write) Multiple Coil (0X) 16 = Preset (Write) Multiple Register (4X)

SlaveAddr.description: This parameter specifies the starting Modbus register or digital point address to be considered by the command in the Modbus slave device. Refer to the documentation of each Modbus slave device on the network for their register and digital point address assignments.
